section: Terms of the project: 12 weeks from February 8, 2018 to May 3, 2018. Client acknowledges and agrees that all due dates set forth in the Scope of Work are guaranteed by the Company, regardless of whether the company receives required materials, documentation, or approvals in a timely fashion from the client. Delays will not affect the due dates.
explanation: This clause presents an inconsistency in the text. While it specifies a 12-week project timeframe from February 8, 2018, to May 3, 2018, it simultaneously states that all due dates are guaranteed by the Company regardless of the Client's provision of necessary materials. This is contradictory because the Company's ability to meet deadlines is dependent on the Client's timely input. Thus, it is logically impossible for the Company to guarantee due dates if the Client is late in submitting essential materials. The project could not finish on time if information from the client is needed. This creates ambiguity as to the actual enforceability of the specified dates and the responsibilities of each party in meeting those dates.

section: Client shall make a prepayment of $1,900 and pay the remaining $3,100 on completion of the Scope of Work. However, the Client can pay the remaining amount at any time, or in multiple installments, before the Scope of Work completion.
explanation: This payment schedule introduces a contradiction. The initial part mandates a $3,100 payment 'on completion of the Scope of Work,' which implies a single lump sum payment upon project completion. The added sentence, however, allows the client to pay the remaining amount at any time, or in multiple installments, before the Scope of Work completion. This creates ambiguity as to the actual payment deadline and the acceptable payment methods, potentially leading to disputes regarding payment terms. While the $1900 is still due, it can be argued that the rest of the payment schedule is now up to the client's choosing.

section: Company is obligated to continue providing Customer Service throughout the duration of this agreement, and may not alter or cease providing Customer Service. Company at its sole discretion may at any time alter or cease providing the Customer Service which it has agreed to provide to Client relating to Client Website pursuant to this Agreement without any liability to Company.
explanation: This section contains a direct contradiction. The first sentence states that the 'Company is obligated to continue providing Customer Service' and 'may not alter or cease providing Customer Service'. However, the very next sentence contradicts this by stating that the 'Company at its sole discretion may at any time alter or cease providing the Customer Service'. This ambiguity creates confusion over the actual Customer Service obligations of the Company. The first part of the edit makes it seem that the Company needs to continue to provide service, but the following sentence contradicts this statement.
